title: Invalid shape error
body:
I have run into an invalid shape error when attempting to perform transfer learning using a custom dataset with two classes of objects:
```
  File "train.py", line 421, in <module>
    train()  # train normally
  File "train.py", line 267, in train
    pred = model(imgs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 547, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/distributed.py", line 444, in forward
    outputs = self.parallel_apply(self._module_copies[:len(inputs)], inputs, kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/distributed.py", line 469, in parallel_apply
    return parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs, self.device_ids[:len(replicas)])
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 85, in parallel_apply
    output.reraise()
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 369, in reraise
    raise self.exc_type(msg)
RuntimeError: Caught RuntimeError in replica 0 on device 0.
Original Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 60, in _worker
    output = module(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 547, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/git/yolov3/models.py", line 240, in forward
    x = module(x, img_size)
  File "/home/ubuntu/anaconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 547, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ubuntu/git/yolov3/models.py", line 149, in forward
    p = p.view(bs, self.na, self.nc + 5, self.ny, self.nx).permute(0, 1, 3, 4, 2).contiguous()  # prediction
RuntimeError: shape '[4, 3, 85, 13, 13]' is invalid for input of size 14196
```

I was able to successfully complete transfer learning on with the YOLOv3-SPP model using the same dataset so I assume the images are OK, at least they were OK for input for that training. Perhaps there's something amiss with the YOLOv3-tiny model configuration?

Thanks in advance for any suggestions or insight.
